comments:
Version:3M8
when the eclipse starts up ,It always asks me to select a work space 
directory,when I select the checkbox "use this as the default and do not ask 
again",It works fine first,but when I rename the eclipse directory or move the 
eclipse directory to some other directory,the program can't startup now,the log 
is list below.
Does this mean that if I install the eclipse to some directory,and I should 
never change or move to another directory?Or I must select a workspace 
everytime it startup ?

Thanks

--

I also find a lot new things.

1?AIf the workspace is outside of my eclise home directory,the find workspace 
directory dialog always shows when I start eclipse,even I choose the checkbox.
Only when I modify the xml file in eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.ui.ide,It 
does not show that dialog anymore.

2?AWhen I start eclipse,It does not select the java file when I selected it 
before close the IDE,but in version 2,It does work.

3?AI backup the configuration(eclipse\configuration) directory,when I change 
the eclipse directory or workspace directory,the eclipse does not startup and 
report errors like I mentioned before,but I copy the configuration directory 
back,and the eclipse startup now.

Thanks

The workspace launcher dialog always showing up may be a duplicate of bug 
55537.  Am transferring to Core to answer questions on moving your workspace 
directory.

Summary:  The only runtime issue is the move/rename of the *** eclipse ***.  
this should have nothing to do with the workspace location.  assuming you do 
not have -data on the command line, all workspace location management is done 
by the UI.

I'll check myself this problem, but at this stage of the game it could be very
welcome if you could verify with on the latest drop or wait for (M9/RC0).

A lot of changes have been done in this area and I suspect it is fine.

Marking as RC1 so we don't forget it :)

I tried the following scenario:
- install eclipse in d:/M9/ (eclipse folder was contained)
- start it, pick a workspace, set use as a default
- exit
- rename M9 to M9b
- start again, the prompter did not get displayed as indicated.

To me, this is fixed. Closing.

Adam, please verify again your use case and reopen if you still has this problem.
